pageTitle: Buses replace trains as track replacement works take place at East Acton

title.title: Buses replace trains as track replacement works take place at East Acton

texts: The Central line will be suspended between White City and Ealing Broadway/ West Ruislip on 13 and 14 August due to track replacement works taking place at East Acton.
Three Rail Replacement Bus services will operate:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["A. Between White City and Northolt","B. Between White City and West Ruislip","C. Between White City and Ealing Broadway"]}

Passengers travelling from/to the following stations are advised to use the 
following routes:
West Ruislip Chiltern Line services from/to Marylebone Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines from/to Ickenham or Ruislip.
Ruislip Gardens Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines from/to Ruilsip or Ruislip Manor.
South Ruislip Chiltern line services from/to Marylebone.
Greenford First Great Western Link services from/to Paddington.Saturday only.
Hanger Lane Piccadilly line from/to Park Royal.
West Acton Piccadilly line from/to North Ealing.
Ealing Broadway District line First Great Western Link services from/to Paddington.

Customers are advised to allow an extra 30 minutes to complete their journeys 
especially those wishing to make the last train connections.

For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call: 020-7222 1234 or visit TfL's website:
www.tfl.gov.uk

Live information on TfL's Realtime pages displays latest updates to London's transport modes, including the Tube, DLR, bus and Network Rail
www.tfl.gov.uk/realtime

Journey Planner checks the transport network's status before providing results. The best available route will be shown automatically
www.tfl.gov.uk/journeyplanner
Travel alerts via SMS and email can be set up at www.tfl.gov.uk/alerts

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Metronet Rail BCV is responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Central line","The Central line is the longest line with 74km (46 miles) serving 49 stations","The longest journey without change on the London Underground can be made on the Central line between West Ruislip and Epping (54.9 km, 34.1 miles)","The Central line features the sharpest curve of the Underground system, named the Caxton curve it is located between Shepherd's Bush and White City"]}
